title: Gates open on showtime
text:
The 2015 Royal Hobart Show will feature Queensland-based entertainers The Rooftop Express. The Mercury 20 Oct 2015 News/Tasmania David Manchon from The Rooftop Express works three steers from the top of his mobile home at the Hobart Showground. Picture: LUKE BOWDEN Source: News Limited 
A COMEDY cattle show will make its Tasmanian debut as part of opening day of the Royal Hobart Show today in what promises to be a hit with show-goers. 
Queensland-based The Rooftop Express is an Australian wild west show of well-trained brahman cattle, dogs and horses performing stunts. 
It is the first time The Rooftop Express has been at the Royal Hobart Show and showman Dave Manchon said the performances would be full of comedy between other showmen. 
“I hope people will get their hands out of the pockets and stamp their feet because it is a really exciting show,” he said. 
Also part of opening day will be the freestyle BMX Bandit, the Zap Circus and a bulls and barrels rodeo, while the vintage machinery display is celebrating 150 years of steam engines in Tasmania. 
The equestrian program is back on site and the traditional animal sheds will house lambs, birds, dogs and cattle.
